Rovos Rail Pretoria to Victoria Falls | World Journeys | World Travellers - World Travellers Find your nearest store Destinations Our Deals About Blogs Contact Us SIGN UP Rovos Rail: Pretoria to Victoria Falls 4 days | Pretoria to Victoria Falls A Luxurious Journey to Victoria Falls Begin your adventure in the historic city of Pretoria, journeying northward across the Tropic of Capricorn into the heart of Zimbabwe. Travel one of the longest straight stretches of railway in the world—114 kilometers of uninterrupted track—before entering the vast wilderness of Hwange National Park. Here, you’ll enjoy an unforgettable game drive through one of Africa’s most diverse wildlife sanctuaries. Your journey culminates at the majestic Victoria Falls, where the mighty Zambezi River plunges into one of the world’s greatest natural wonders. Beyond the falls, the area offers a range of thrilling experiences—from sunset river cruises and whitewater rafting to exceptional game viewing and photographic safaris. Day 2: Onboard Travel through baobab country towards Bulawayo, enjoying all the comforts and gourmet delights of your luxury train. Day 3: Hwange National Park Journey along the eastern edge of Hwange National Park, then enjoy a game drive in the park from the renowned The Hide luxury safari camp to spot wildlife. Day 4: Victoria Falls Arrive in Victoria Falls where the journey ends. Your Train Step aboard Rovos Rail and journey back to a golden age of travel, where luxury meets vintage charm. Renowned for its meticulously restored carriages, Rovos Rail offers opulent accommodations ranging from Pullman to Royal Suites — many featuring Victorian-style baths, separate showers, and period furnishings that echo the elegance of a bygone era. Dine in refined style in the formal dining car, where gourmet cuisine is served on fine china, accompanied by crystal glassware and a curated selection of exquisite South African wines — all part of the all-inclusive experience. Socialize in the plush lounge cars, sip handcrafted cocktails in the bar car, or soak in panoramic views from the open-air observation car — the perfect spot to take in Southern Africa’s breathtaking landscapes. Attentive service is at the heart of the journey, with suites serviced daily by a dedicated host or hostess, and thoughtful touches like robes, slippers, and bespoke amenities provided for your comfort. To preserve the tranquil, nostalgic atmosphere, there are no televisions or radios onboard — just the rhythmic sound of the rails and the timeless romance of luxury train travel.
